quotes.quote: Play is the beginning of knowledge.
Never play anything the same way twice.
Play energizes us and enlivens us. It eases our burdens. It renews our natural sense of optimism and opens us up to new possibilities.
Play needs direction as well as work.
Play is a uniquely adaptive act, not subordinate to some other adaptive act, but with a special function of its own in human experience.
You have to learn the rules of the game. And then you have to play better than anyone else.
Play becomes joy, joy becomes work, work becomes play.
Play is the work of childhood.
You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
We don't stop playing because we grow old; we grow old because we stop playing.
Children need the freedom and time to play. Play is not a luxury. Play is a necessity.
The creation of something new is not accomplished by the intellect but by the play instinct.
Play is the highest form of research.
Play is the exultation of the possible.
It is better to play than do nothing.
It is a happy talent to know how to play.
We are never more fully alive, more completely ourselves, or more deeply engrossed in anything than when we are playing.
Don't play what's there, play what's not there.

Play, while it cannot change the external realities of children's lives, can be a vehicle for children to explore and enjoy their differences and similarities and to create, even for a brief time, a more just world where everyone is an equal and valued participant.
Life is like a game of cards. The hand you are dealt is determinism; the way you play it is free will.
Man's most serious activity is play.
Life is more fun if you play games.
Play is your route to mastery.
The quality of a play is the quality of its ideas.
Children learn as they play. Most importantly, in play children learn how to learn.
Play is our brain's favourite way of learning.
When you work, work. When you play, play. Don't mix the two.
Play is often talked about as if it were a relief from serious learning. But for children play is serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood.
Play is the only way the highest intelligence of humankind can unfold.
Play keeps us vital and alive. It gives us an enthusiasm for life that is irreplaceable. Without it, life just doesn't taste good.
